messages: f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:01): does anyone know where I can find some easy to follow instructions for accessing W3C's CVS via the command line, so I can check specs in and out on my mac instead of having to move everything to windows first?
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:13): lachy, *which* CVS are you interested in?
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:13): dev.w3.org or cvs.w3.org?
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:13): or, put differently, the html5 spec, or something else?

8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:14): also, do you already have access from Windows (i.e. this is a Mac support question), or do you not have access at all so far (i.e., this is an access rights question)?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:16): 8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393, the stuff on dev.w3.org. In particular, Selectors API and the HTML5 authoring guide
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:16): do you have access from Windows already?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:16): I use TortoiseCVS
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:16): you have write access?
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:17): do you have the ssh key that you use from Windows on the Mac?
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:17): (the private key, that is)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:18): yes, I put my private key in ~/.ssh/identity
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:18): CVS_RSH=ssh cvs -d <email/>:/sources/public co html5
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:19): ... should check out the html5 repository
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:19): inside that directory, you can then use cvs update, cvs commit, cvs diff etc
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:19): cvs is installed by default on macs, I believe
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:21): woot! I got it to work :-)
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:21): you probably want to set the CVS_RSH environment variable globally
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:21): I already did that
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:21): perfect
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:21): this told me how http://hurring.com/scott/howto/cvs_ssh/
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:22): so I just type this and it works: cvs -d $CVSROOT checkout 2006/webapi/
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:27): 8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393, to commit, is this the right command: cvs commit -m "some log message" Overview.src.html
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:28): or just "cvs commit"
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:29): it should invoke an editor for the commit message, and commit all changed files in the current directory
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:29): I have no clue whatsoever what the build environment looks like, so you'll want to check with whoever has the lead on editing whatever document you touch ;-)
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:29): "cvs commit" might tell you that the file is out of date
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:29): in that case, do cvs update
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:29): and possibly resolve conflicts manually
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:29): but you probably know that routine from Windows
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:30): I have the lead on the documents I touch. I'm the editor for selectors api and html5 author guide
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:30): most excellent...
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:31): I'm just in the process of converting from a long time windows user to a mac user
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:31): and thus having to learn the command line
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:31): I just wish there were TortoiseCVS/SVN for Mac
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (15:31): changed from Linux to Mac, and is therefore used to command line
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:33): cool, it all worked http://dev.w3.org/cvsweb/2006/webapi/selectors-api/Overview.src.html
b41b3e8a12db500858663a5e377e1476 (15:44): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: BBEdit, an otherwise excellent text editor for Mac OS X, also has some limited VCS support built in.
